Collector K.S. Palanisamy has cautioned people against straying into the Veeramalaipalayam shooting range in Manapparai taluk between March 28 and 31 when the Army personnel are expected to train at the range. People are also advised not to let out their cattle for grazing in the range from 7.30 a.m. to 5.30 p.m., he said in a press release.

Tax collection drive

The Tiruchi Corporation has launched an intensive tax collection drive to mop up tax dues from the residents. The drive would be conducted till March 31, Corporation Commissioner N.S.Prema said in a press release. All tax collection centres would function from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. on all working days, she said and urged residents to remit their property tax, water charge and other tax dues immediately.

Stickers on cash bags of conductors

Stepping up the voter awareness initiatives to achieve cent per cent polling, authorities in the district sought to drive home the messages through conductors of State Transport Corporations here on Friday.

Accordingly, awareness stickers are to be pasted on the cash bags of about 2050 conductors serving on the STC buses. Collector K.S.Palanisamy, who inaugurated the exercise, urged voters to help achieve the object of achieving cent per cent polling in the Assembly election.
title: Beware of shooting range
